Sentencas: The substitution effect of 5 mol% calcium at perovskite B site was investigated systematically for yttrium doped barium zirconate, including phase structure, stability in different atmospheres, electrical conductivities and sinterability.
Titulo: Effect of low-level Ca2+ substitution at perovskite B site on the properties of BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: In XRD patterns, BaZr0.8Y0.15Ca0.05O3-delta (BZYC5) powders synthesized by a citrate-nitrate combustion method show the cubic perovskite structure with a = 4.211 angstrom, and its characteristic diffraction peak shift toward the low-angle side compared to BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-delta (BZY) indicates that Ca2+ occupies the B site.
Titulo: Effect of low-level Ca2+ substitution at perovskite B site on the properties of BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: The sintering shrinkage measurement and SEM images display a better sintering activity of BZYC5 than BZY.
Titulo: Effect of low-level Ca2+ substitution at perovskite B site on the properties of BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: In both wet hydrogen and air environment, BZYC5 exhibits a higher total conductivity than BZY, which might be attributed to the enhancement of both proton formation/transportability and sintering activity.
Titulo: Effect of low-level Ca2+ substitution at perovskite B site on the properties of BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: In addition, BZYC5 remains stable after CO2 and water vapor treatment, indicating a small amount of Ca2+ doping does not change the chemical stability of BZY.
Titulo: Effect of low-level Ca2+ substitution at perovskite B site on the properties of BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: The anode-supported single cell with dense BZYC5 electrolyte was successfully assembled and its electrochemical properties were tested, giving a high peak power density of 218 mW cm(-2) at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Effect of low-level Ca2+ substitution at perovskite B site on the properties of BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: These results suggest that BZYC5 is a promising electrolyte candidate for proton-conducting SOFCs.
Titulo: Effect of low-level Ca2+ substitution at perovskite B site on the properties of BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ
